column4: does anyone know how to customize which packages get installed with ubuntu? i tried both custom (which just does minimal) and expert (which just gives you a menu). i know what's included is already minimal, but there are some things I want to leave out.
use aptitude or synaptic or apt-get
known issue, base your decision on the filename
okay, so I'll redownload and hope to get the final this time
huh?
if you downloaed one names -release-, it's the release iso
oh, i thought you meant base it on the DISKNAME (as opposed to the md5sum)
no
nevermind then, thanks, i have the "release"
cool
the base you get with expert isn't minimal enough?
what i meant was, i do want office/firefox, just not gaim (as an example)
the custom install doesn't include gaim
and you can remove gaim from the default install if you like, too
right, but it doesn't include office/firefox or even gnome either
er, so what do you want? you can build up from custom or build down from desktop.
how do i remove gaim (and other stuff) from the default install. is that the .disk/base_exclude that Kamion is referring to?
ok, i think I get what you mean now (build up from custom or build down from desktop). thanks again
np
you've not used a Debian-based distro before?
no, but i have heard of apt, so i just have to learn it now
ah, right
fwiw, "dsh" + "apt-get remove gaim gnomemeeting..." can make that easier
thanks
